meanings.definition: The darkening or shading of edges in a photograph or image.
meanings.sent1: The vignetting in the photo added a nice artistic touch to the edges.
meanings.sent2: The photographer intentionally included vignetting to draw attention to the center of the image.
meanings.sent3: The vignetting in the picture made it look like it was fading into darkness at the corners.
meanings.sent4: Her memories had a subtle vignetting effect, with the edges blurred like forgotten details.
meanings.sent5: The vignetting created a dreamy atmosphere, as if the scene was a fading memory.

meanings.definition: To darken or shade the edges of a photograph or image.
meanings.sent1: She decided to vignette the photo to focus the viewer's gaze on the subject.
meanings.sent2: Vignetting can be used to enhance the mood of a picture by framing it with darkness.
meanings.sent3: The artist playfully vignetted the edges of the painting, giving it a mysterious aura.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the shadows vignetted the landscape, creating a dramatic effect.
meanings.sent5: The candlelight vignetted the room, casting a warm glow around the edges.
